questions.stem: Which of the following compounds would give the following set of qualitative analysis? (i) Fehling’s Test: Positive (ii) Na fusion extract upon treatment with sodium nitroprusside gives a blood red colour but not
questions.explanation: Aromatic aldehydes do not give Fehling's test. Both nitrogen and sulfur must be present to obtain blood red colour. Sodium nitroprusside gives blood red colour with S & N.
questions.tip_formula: Fehling's test is positive for aldehydes except aromatic ones.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: What is the correct order of acidity of the protons marked A–D in the given compounds?
questions.explanation: Acidity of an acid depends upon the stability of its conjugate base. The more stable the conjugate base, the stronger the acid.
questions.tip_formula: Acidity is related to the stability of the conjugate base.
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Given below are two statements: Assertion (A): Ketoses give Seliwanoff’s test faster than Aldoses. Reason (R): Ketoses undergo β-elimination followed by formation of furfural.

options.text: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)

questions.explanation: Seliwanoff's test is a differentiating test for Ketose and aldose. Ketoses are more rapidly dehydrated to form 5-hydroxy methyl furfural when heated in acidic medium.
questions.tip_formula: Seliwanoff's test differentiates ketoses from aldoses.
questions.subject: Chemistry
